section.p: If another user has prepared a markup table for your translation environment, you must import it in order to be able to use it in .
Markup tables can only be imported in external format.

section.title: Prerequisites
section.p: The Markup Table List window must be active.

section.title: Calling sequence
section.p: Select Importâ€¦ from the File menu.
The Import Markup Table window is displayed (see ). windowsImport Markup Table Import Markup Table windowFigure shows Import Markup Table window

section.title: Options and parameters

plentry.pd: Specify where the markup table to be imported currently resides and select the drive where the external markup table is stored. Name Type the name of the external markup table or select the name from the following list boxes. Current directory Displays the directory selected from the Directories list box. Directories Select the directory containing the external markup table from the list of directories on the selected drive. Files Select the file name of the external markup table from the list of names in the currently selected path.

Contains the name of the selected markup table to be imported. You can overwrite this name to create a new markup table or select a name from the list box to merge your file into an existing markup table.

section.p: To start the importing function, select the Import button.

section.title: Results
section.p: The markup table is now available in , you can start to associate it with documents or folders.
